data.text: Yea, I know that pleading is out of my reach;
Who would then know that I might find him,
And I would plead my own cause,
And I would know the remedies which he would speak to me,
Though he should come on me in his great strength,
For truth and reproof are from him;
For if I shall go first, and exist no longer,
When he wrought on the left hand, then I observed it not:
For he knows already my way;
And I will go forth according to his commandments,
And if too he has thus judged, who is he that has contradicted,
Therefore am I troubled at him;
Therefore let me take good heed before him:
But the Lord has softened my heart,
For I knew not that darkness would come upon me,
